p.n.countbook

Class Counter

  • java.lang.Object
    • p.n.countbook.Counter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Counter
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A counter is basic counting object which allows a name for an item, a count for an item (and its count on initialisation), as well as a comment for that item and the date for when these variables were initialized or changed to be associated. A comment may be blank, and the set count is also declared as it's initial count. The MasterCounterListControl extension of AppcompatActivity allows saving/loading a list of such objects to a file through gson. The count or current_value may be increased or decreased by one in the positive integer range. The count can be reset to that initial value, and that date variable can be udated to the current date.
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    Counter, MasterCounterListControl, NewCounterActivity, EditCounterActivity, ViewCounterActivity, CounterListActivity, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Counter(java.lang.String name, int initial_value)
      Initializes a count with just a name and a count (Set as the intital and current count), but with a blank comment.
      Counter(java.lang.String name, int initial_value, java.lang.String comment)
      Initializes a count with just a name and a count (Set as the intital and current count), but with a user-defined comment.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void downCount()
      Decreases the count (current_value) by one, down to at most zero.

      Returns the comment string.
      int getCurrent_value()
      Return the current value integer.

      Returns the Objects date object in "yyyy-MM-dd" format as a string
      int getInitial_value()
      Return the Initial value as an int.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Return the name String
      void resetCurrent_value()
      Resets current_value to initial_value.
      void setComment(java.lang.String comment)
      Change the comment, it may be blank.
      void setCurrent_value(int current_value)
      Sets current_value, takes in any new non-negative current value.
      void setInitial_value(int initial_value)
      Set the Initial value as an int , which is more like a default value I guess.
      void setName(java.lang.String name)
      Change the name String
      java.lang.String toString()
      When Counter is called to a string, it's toString simply returns the Counter Name and current count concatenated.
      void upCount()
      Increases the count (current_value) by one.
